attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: Launch an awareness campaign for the causes and symptoms of skin cancer
attributes.background: Last year I had Melanoma and there was little awareness out there, there is more than 1 type of skin cancer. I feel that there is little awareness out there about them and about damage the sun/sun beds can do. There needs to be more campaigns to help prevent it.

attributes.action: Introduce Stronger Legislation Governing The Sale of Animal Grooming Products.
attributes.background: At present, companies that produce cosmetic products for animals are under no legal compulsion to label their products appropriately or adhere to the safety standards that regulate the sale of human cosmetics. We want the UK Government to address this with the introduction of stronger legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation affecting the sale of pet products is currently encompassed by EU Cosmetic Regulation 1223/2009 and Section 7.7 (a) of Regulation (EC) No 648/2004 on detergents (European Union, 2009) which states there is no 'sector specific' legislation governing the sale of pet grooming products. We believe the UK can lead the world in introducing stronger legislation forcing a reappraisal in the way in which these products are regulated and labelled.

attributes.action: At 17 you should be able to ride atleast a 250Cc superbike / Pitbike ( Crosser )
attributes.background:
At 17 you're legally allowed to ride a 125Cc. (75 MPH max ).        
So instead make it so you can ride a 250 Cc.

attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Institute a Personage & Citizenry Act
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on parliament to institute a new act that grants automatic citizenship to any persons that can demonstrate that they have lived continuously in this country for 15 or more years. Subject to having not committed a serious criminal offence
attributes.additional_details:
This act would help secure the rights of people affected by the windrush scandal as well as those people who have migrated here that may be subject to the same treatment in the future.

Personage should be granted to those who are working here to act as a temporary status of citizenry for 5 years. If they continue to hold employment for that time then at the end of the 5 years they are granted full citizenry.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Teach about Babylonian history in schools!
attributes.background: The babylionan civilasation contributed immensly in shaping the worlds history. They contributed to one of the earliest forms of writting, the first ever laws through the code of Hammurabi, science and astrology and maths. This should be taught in schools.

attributes.action: Cap the price of private and university owned student accommodation
attributes.background: Students are becoming more ripped off by the price of student accommodation each year thus becoming harder to live. It is already unfair that Student Finance dictate our maintenance loan based on our household income and the majority have to live in a student overdraft. We want fair reduced prices.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Urge the international community to bring Bashar al Assad to justice.
attributes.background:
Since the start of the Syrian Civil War in 2011, hundreds of thousands of civilians have been murdered in Syria, with the vast majority of deaths being attributed to Assad and his forces.

The international community must do more to bring Assad to justice.
attributes.additional_details:
Assad has invalidated his sovereignty over Syria. Hundreds of thousands of his own people have been murdered and tortured. Intervention is justified and necessary both morally and politically on the basis of these grave human rights violations. 

http://sn4hr.org

http://www.syriahr.com/en/

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Provide Network Rail with funding for the second entrance at Putney Station
attributes.background:
Wandsworth Council have been pushing for a 2nd entrance to Putney Station for years, but have failed to secure funding.

This project would improve access between SWT and District Line and reduce congestion in the main entrance. Please back this project with government funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Wandsworth Council article showing the benefits to locals:
http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/13181/rail_passengers_urged_to_quiz_rail_chiefs_on_new_station_entrance

Local Guardian article about the plans:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/10636235.Train_bosses_urged_to_consider_second_entrance_plan_for_Putney_station/

Putney High Street is also one of the most polluted roads in London, so this project would have health benefits, as well as saving time for passengers.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Make black plastic illegal
attributes.background: Currently in the UK only a third of plastic can be recycled. The public have been placing their plastic in the green bins completely unawares that most will end in landfill or incinerated. One of the quickest ways the Government can reduce this is to ban black plastic packaging.
attributes.additional_details: This featured as a main story on the BBC news on the 4th of August 2018.

attributes.action: To make the M5 north and south bond to 4/5 lanes wide from Exeter to Bristol.
attributes.background: The M5 north and south bond is one of the most congested motorways in the country and each week thousands of people are stuck in heavy traffic jams turning1 hour trips into 4 hours of stand still traffic. Extending each side to 4 or 5 lanes would increase the flow of traffic and decrease congestion.

attributes.action: Create a new Ministerial Department called the Department For a Fair Society.
attributes.background:
New technologies could benefit everyone but instead, they are often exploited for maximum corporate profit 
The DFFS should: 
a) Find and support technologies that can have a revolutionary positive impact on society
b) Champion them to other government departments, the press and business groups
attributes.additional_details:
Technology already exists that can break the vicious circle of poverty, give fair access to top quality education and healthcare, and end the exploitation of vulnerable people by unscrupulous business. Instead of trying to fix our broken economy, these technologies could be harnessed to create a new, ethical model that will not favour the rich over the poor or any other group over another.
The DFFS would lead the country, and the rest of the world, to a fairer, more inclusive model for society.

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Legislate to allow for ‘no questions asked’ divorces in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: We the undersigned call on the Government to amend current divorce legislation to allow for a ‘no questions asked’ divorce granted 28 days after the acceptance of the decree nisi. The decree absolute being granted on the 29th day.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: Ban Online Casinos
attributes.background: Online casinos cause misery for the user and their families and friends.This is an addictive gambling machine and not a fun way to waste peoples money. Ban all online and shop based slot machines.

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldn’t be banned. It’s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Ban the use of straws and plastic packaging in the UK
attributes.background: Plastic is polluting the ocean. Marine species then eat it causing plastic toxins to be absorbed into their body and enter the food chain. The plastic in their environment can also hurt the animals.

attributes.action: Allow fathers in employment to have time off for scans and parenting classes
attributes.background: First time dad. Gov.co.uk states maximum two appointments for scans etc. Employers shouldn’t be allowed to force dads to use their holidays for scan appointments. As fathers we should be allowed every appointment off work.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I have to go to various hospitals for scans to ensure everything is right. I must use my holiday hours. I can take time off for a doctors or hospital appointment, because it's for me but I can’t have time off for scans because it's not directly for me! Slight discrimination!”

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Make Jordan Pickford’s birthday (March 7th) a national holiday
attributes.background: Jordan Pickford has been England’s Number 1 goalkeeper at the 2018 World Cup and he has been brilliant. Jordan Pickford’s birthday should be a national holiday to celebrate his performances at the 2018 World Cup.

attributes.action: Take back control of disabled persons services and standardised across the UK
attributes.background: There are many differences between counties in the services that are available. This makes it difficult to understand and it shouldn't be down to your postcode as to which services you can access.

attributes.action: Better Mental Health Services for Autistic Individuals.
attributes.background: Better Mental Health Services are needed for Autistic Individuals. It is important to have the right mental health services for autistic teenagers and adults to help with the stresses and strains of mental health as well as daily life. There are not enough services specific for those with an ASC.

attributes.action: Force all meat packaging to use images of slaughterhouses to deglamourise meat
attributes.background: Packets of cigarettes after having adopted grotesque images of the effects of smoking in 2008 have reduced the number of smokers significantly in the UK. I am calling on the government to adopt a similar scheme with meat packaging in order to warn people about what they are eating.
attributes.additional_details: Pictures would be stark to illustrate the appalling conditions that animals live in; the effects on health of meat-eating; and the environmental toll that raising animals for meat has.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Adopt the STV voting system for a more representative government.
attributes.background: Our current FPTP voting system is extremely flawed. The system has been in use for so long that, just like the USA, we are stuck in a two-party system that we will never be able to break out of.
attributes.additional_details:
Let’s imagine a new country adopts the system and holds the first election. The results are-
Blue- 27% of votes 
Green-32% of votes
Red-21% of votes
Yellow-20% of votes.
Green party wins with only 32% of the country’s representatives but is elected PM (68% of the country is unrepresented).
This is the system we have in the UK. 
I don’t have enough characters left to explain the benefits of STV, but please use these videos to learn-
https://youtu.be/P38Y4VG1Ibo
https://youtu.be/l8XOZJkozfI

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.
